intro: Calathea macilenta, commonly known as the prayer plant, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, variegated foliage with intricate patterns and shades of green, silver, and pink. The leaves are oval-shaped and often exhibit a unique upward movement during the day, closing at night—a behavior known as nyctinasty. This plant thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistently moist, well-draining soil. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
